roleset.name: attract

role.descr: thing attracted to, if separate from attractor

example.name: entice into
example.text: The major question, said one holder who asked not to be named, is whether New York investor Bennett S. LeBow, whose Brooke Partners controls Western Union, is willing to offer a large enough equity stake *trace* to entice bondholders into agreeing to a new swap.
example.arg: into agreeing to a new swap.

example.name: just transitive
example.text: But there was a dearth of sellers, traders said, so buyers-1 had to bid prices up *trace*-1 to entice them.

example.name: ARG3 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: The government and the ANC , the bitterest of enemies , are engaged in an elaborate mating dance designed to entice each other to the negotiating table .

roleset.note: ENTICE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'entice' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet entry 31.1, other framed members include comfort, convince, depress, encourage, exhaust, interest, reassure, repel, scare, shock, spook, threaten, and worry. Framenet entry Suasion1. Comparison with attract. (from entice.01-v predicate notes)
